conseil:
Evaluer que les choses ne nous échappent pas et que nous avons une marge de contrôle sur ces dernières peut être corrélé à un bon moral:

Personal control and health promotion - Social Science & Medicine

Stress, personal control and health - American Psychological Association (APA)

Control and Health - Psychology Today

The Role of Locus of Control in Daily Life - Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin

Contenir ses émotions sans les confier pourrait être intenable et compliquer leur régulation et il semblerait qu'il existe des liens entre la capacité à faire confiance et une auto-évaluation positive du bonheur:

Emotion Elicits the Social Sharing of Emotion: Theory and Empirical Review - Université Catholique de Louvain

Generalized Trust and Intelligence in the United States - Department of Sociology and Nuffield College, University of Oxford, Oxford, United Kingdom

La culpabilité pourrait être en lien avec la depression

Guilt, fear, submission, and empathy in depression - Journal of Affective Disorders

Brain scans support Freud: Guilt plays key role in depression - University of Manchester

L'anxiété peut être empirée par un manque de sommeil :

Sleep-deprived and anxious? This brain region helps to explain why - Nature

Tired and edgy? Sleep deprivation boosts anticipatory anxiety - Berkeley News

Stressed to the max? Deep sleep can rewire the anxious brain - Berkeley News

Overanxious and underslept - Nature Human Behaviour

L'anxiété et les inflammations pourraient être réduites par la consommation de chocolat noir:

New studies show dark chocolate consumption reduces stress and inflammation, while improving memory, immunity and mood

Dark Chocolate Intake Buffers Stress Reactivity in Humans - Journal of the American College of Cardiology

Dark chocolate attenuates intracellular pro-inflammatory reactivity to acute psychosocial stress in men: A randomized controlled trial - Brain, Behavior, and Immunity

L'anxiété peut venir d'une faim:

Pourquoi sommes-nous de mauvaise humeur quand nous avons faim ? - Cerveau&Psycho

An exploration of the aversive properties of 2-deoxy-D-glucose in rats - Department of Psychology and Neuroscience, University of Guelph

Le sport a une incidence positive contre la dépression:

Effects of physical exercise on anxiety, depression, and sensitivity to stress: A unifying theory - Clinical Psychology Review

Il semblerait que le ressentiment abîme et que certains groupes non depressifs pardonnent plus facilement par rapport à des groupes d'individus dépressifs:

Effects of lifetime stress exposure on mental and physical health in young adulthood: How stress degrades and forgiveness protects health - Department of Psychology, Luther College, USA

Comparison of Forgiveness in Clinical Depressed, Non-Clinical Depressed and Normal People - Department of Psychology, University of Tehran

...et il pourrait conduire à certains problèmes :

The Association of Anger and Hostility With Future Coronary Heart Disease: A Meta-Analytic Review of Prospective Evidence - Journal of the American College of Cardiology

Forgiveness, Stress, and Health: a 5-Week Dynamic Parallel Process Study - Department of Psychology, Luther College, USA

Les émotions (comme la tristesse) pourraient être contagieuses:

Establishment of an animal model of depression contagion - Behavioural Brain Research

Suicide and Friendships Among American Adolescents - Columbia University

...mais on peut éviter cette contagion par le sport? :

A model of negative emotional contagion between male-female rat dyads: Effects of voluntary exercise on stress-induced behavior and BDNF-TrkB signaling - Physiology & Behavior

Le rejet social inflige une douleur qui mobilise les mêmes circuits que ceux activés par la souffrance physique et peut mener à la violence:

Study illuminates the ‘pain’ of social rejection - Michigan News

Social rejection is painful and can lead to violence - Virginia Commonwealth University

Does rejection hurt? An FMRI study of social exclusion - Department of Psychology, University of California

Réguler son impulsivité est très important pour garantir la vie sociale:

Maîtriser son impulsivité - Cerveau&Psycho

Le cortex préfrontal est employé pour réguler l'impulsivité :

The Claustrum-Prefrontal Cortex Pathway Regulates Impulsive-Like Behavior - The journal of neuroscience

Le cortex préfrontal est aussi employé pour les fonctions cognitives supérieures (le Macaque dispose d'un cortex préfrontal moins large) :

Cortex préfrontal - Wikipedia

Un consommation non modérée de sucre conduit à des troubles depressifs:

The depressogenic potential of added dietary sugars - University of Kansas

...et à l'augmentation des inflammations:

Does sugar cause inflammation in the body? - MedicalNewsToday

...augmente l'état de fatigue:

Sugar rush or sugar crash? A meta-analysis of carbohydrate effects on mood - Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews

La méditation permettrait de réduire l'anxiété et la dépression:

The effect of mindfulness-based therapy on anxiety and depression: A meta-analytic review - American Psychological Association

La méditation pourrait améliorer certaines fonctions cognitives :

Mindful breath awareness meditation facilitates efficiency gains in brain networks: A steady-state visually evoked potentials study - Nature, Institute of Psychology, Experimental Psychology I, Osnabrück University, Osnabrück, Germany

Réseau du mode par défaut - Wikipedia ... et a une véritable incidence sur la concentration

Neural correlates of attentional expertise in long-term meditation practitioners - Columbia University

L'anxiété et la depression peuvent venir d'un manque de vitamines (notamment vitamine D) :

- Institute of Endocrinology, Prague, Czech Republic, 2National Institute of Mental Health, Klecany,Czech Republic

- Potential Role of Vitamin D for the Management of Depression and Anxiety - Department of Biochemistry, Center for Biological Sciences, Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina

- Increased anxiety in mice lacking vitamin D receptor gene - University of Tampere

- Hypovitaminosis D is associated with depression and anxiety in schizophrenia: Results from the national FACE-SZ cohort - Fondation FondaMental

La température ambiante a une incidence sur la santé mentale:

- Temperature and mental health: Evidence from the spectrum of mental health outcomes - University of Massachusetts

- Associations between high ambient temperatures and heat waves with mental health outcomes: a systematic review - Public Health England

- Relationship between daily suicide counts and temperature in England and Wales - Department of Psychological Medicine, Institute of Psychiatry, King's College London

- Relationship Between Ambient Temperature and Humidity and Visits to Mental Health Emergency Departments in Québec - Psychiatric Services

- Temperature and mental health: Evidence from the spectrum of mental health outcomes - University of Massachusetts

Certaines formes d'anxiétés pourraient être mésinterpretées par le corps comme un symptôme d'attirance passionnelle:

- Some evidence for heightened sexual attraction under conditions of high anxiety. - Journal of Personality and Social Psychology

- Misattribution of arousal - Wikipedia

Un sommeil excessif augmente les risques de diabète de type 2, de problèmes cardiaques, d'inflammations, et la population possédant des problèmes psychologiques a plus tendance à avoir un sommeil excessif. Un sommeil trop faible implique également des complications :

The Risks of Sleeping “Too Much”. Survey of a National Representative Sample of 24671 Adults (INPES Health Barometer) - Université Paris Descartes

Seven to Eight Hours of Sleep a Night Is Associated with a Lower Prevalence of the Metabolic Syndrome and Reduced Overall Cardiometabolic Risk in Adults - PlosOne

Sleep duration and risk of type 2 diabetes: a meta-analysis of prospective studies - American Diabetes Association

Sleep Duration and Biomarkers of Inflammation - Sleep

Extreme Sleep Durations and Increased C-Reactive Protein: Effects of Sex and Ethnoracial Group

Sleep disturbances and depression: risk relationships for subsequent depression and therapeutic implications - Dialogues in Clinical Neuroscience

Sleep duration and depressive symptoms: a gene-environment interaction

L'irrégularité dans les rythmes de sommeil peut induire des complications mentales et augmenter l'inertie au réveil :

Circadian Rhythm Sleep Disorders - The Journal of Clinical Outcomes Management

Consistency where it counts: Sleep regularity is associated with circulating white blood cell count in young adults - Brain, Behavior, & Immunity - Health

The Rhythm is Gonna Get You: Social Rhythms, Sleep, Depressive, and Anxiety Symptoms - Journal of Affective Disorders

Irregular sleep-wake patterns in older adults with current or remitted depression - Journal of Affective Disorders

Sleep Regularity and Cardiometabolic Heath: Is Variability in Sleep Patterns a Risk Factor for Excess Adiposity and Glycemic Dysregulation? - Columbia University

The Relationship Between Lifestyle Regularity and Subjective Sleep Quality - The Journal of Biological and Medical Rhythm Research

Circadian Preference and Sleep-Wake Regularity: Associations With Self-Report Sleep Parameters in Daytime-Working Adults - University of California

Faire des siestes de 10 à 20 minutes (et pas plus!) peut améliorer les fonctions cognitives et diminuer l'état de fatigue :

A 30-Minute, but Not a 10-Minute Nighttime Nap is Associated with Sleep Inertia - Centre for Sleep Research, University of South Australia

A Brief Afternoon Nap Following Nocturnal Sleep Restriction: Which Nap Duration is Most Recuperative? - American Academy of Sleep Medicine

The effects of napping on cognitive functioning - School of Psychology, Flinders University

Le temps d'endormissement moyen est de 10 à 20 minutes

Sleep Latency - Principles and Practice of Sleep Medicine (Sixth Edition), 2017

Avoir une alarme mélodieuse peut diminuer la sleep inertia (inertie du sommeil):

Alarm tones, music and their elements: Analysis of reported waking sounds to counteract sleep inertia

Le pessimisme est corrélé à des troubles psychiques comme le stress ou la depression:

Trait Pessimism Predicts Vulnerability to Stress-Induced Anhedonia in Rats - Neuropsychopharmacology

Is pessimism a risk factor for depressive mood among community-dwelling older adults? - Behaviour Research and Therapy

Depression, Pessimism, and Health - University of Miami

Neural correlates of 'pessimistic' attitude in depression - University of Zurich

Is pessimism a risk factor for depressive mood among community-dwelling older adults? - Behaviour Research and Therapy

Des méthodes de cohérence cardiaque peuvent aider à éteindre la panique et l'angoisse:

Biofeedback par la cohérence cardiaque : nouvelle approche du trouble panique - Journal de Thérapie Comportementale et Cognitive

La cohérence cardiaque : état des connaissances actuelles et bénéfices en psychiatrie - CHU Caen, service universitaire de psychiatrie, centre Esquirol, Caen, France

5 minutes de cohérence cardiaque

Rester assis trop longtemps pourrait induire des complications psychologiques:

Too much sitting could hurt your mental health - Science News for students

Energy expenditure during common sitting and standing tasks: examining the 1.5 MET definition of sedentary behaviour - BMC Public Health

Le sport pourrait accélerer les changement physiologiques du réveil, limitant l'inertie du sommeil:

Exercising Caution Upon Waking–Can Exercise Reduce Sleep Inertia? - Frontiers in Physiology

Les câlins et les caresses pourraient permetre de diminuer le stress (et la depression):

Besoin d'un câlin? - Arte

Coronavirus: Why going without physical touch is so hard? - BBC news

Evidence That Little Touches Do Mean So Much - TheNewYorkTimes

Affection deprivation: What happens to our bodies when we go without touch? - Independent

Les émotions et les sentiments peuvent permettre une mémorisation plus efficace:

L'émotion, ciment du souvenir - Ceveau & Psycho

La mémorisation espacée permet d'apprendre plus efficacement des connaissances:

The impact of binge watching on memory and perceived comprehension

Courbe de l'oubli - Wikipedia

Replication and Analysis of Ebbinghaus' Forgetting Curve - University of Amsterdam

Le café peut améliorer l'attention et certaines fonctions cognitives, mais aussi conduire à des problèmes de tolérance et de sevrage:

A review of caffeine's effects on cognitive, physical and occupational performance - Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews

Caffeine improves reaction time, vigilance and logical reasoning during extended periods with restricted opportunities for sleep - Center for Psychiatry and Neuroscience

A review of caffeine’s effects on cognitive, physical and occupational performance - Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews

The effect of caffeine on cognitive task performance and motor fatigue - University of Groningen

Les pauses qui activent le réseau par défaut sont plus efficaces sur l'augmentation de la productivité et rendent plus productif:

Réseau du mode par défaut - Wikipedia

Une pause au travail ? Oui, mais pas n’importe laquelle ! - The Conversation

L’étude qui prouve que la pause rend plus productif au travail

La méditation augmente certaines fonctions cognitives:

Mindful breath awareness meditation facilitates efficiency gains in brain networks: A steady-state visually evoked potentials study - Nature

Un sommeil interrompu ou de mauvaise qualité diminue les capacités cognitives:

- Effects of one night of induced night-wakings versus sleep restriction on sustained attention and mood: a pilot study - Sleep Medicine

- Chronical sleep interruption-induced cognitive decline assessed by a metabolomics method - Behavioural Brain Research

Voir la situation comme la promesse d'une récompense ou comme la condition de l'absence d'une punition change le comportement:

- Opposing Contributions of GABAergic and Glutamatergic Ventral Pallidal Neurons to Motivational Behaviors - Neuron

On peut utiliser la méthode du Drill pour apprendre plus facilement:

- Drill(éducation) - Wikipedia

Plus on est exposé à quelque-chose plus on a tendance à l'apprécier:

- Effet de simple exposition - Wikipedia

Apprendre se fait par l'erreur de prédiction de la récompense chez les primates:

- Dopamine responses comply with basic assumptions of formal learning theory - Nature
